page.title: 20Branchline electrification
page.content: The{railway}has always been an important link between South Woodham Ferrers and London. The line, which was originally opened in 1889, has seen a 'hey' day and been threatened with closure. The yachtsmen visiting Burnham and the many commuters using the line has prompted today's present development. The whole line will be fully automated by May '86. There will be automatic crossing gates and a new modern system of track-circuit signals Raising the bridges is the hardest work, but completion will mean 15-20 minuits off travelling time. Parents are concerned for the safety of their children using the new crossings, but when they understand how they work their fears will be allieviated.
